title: Student Activities
content: Students in the Master of Safety and Risk Engineering program participate in a variety of activities that support academic development and professionalism. These activities include safety seminars and workshops, industrial visits to transportation and manufacturing companies, and case-based risk management simulations. Students also engage in collaborative research projects with government institutions and private sectors, contributing practical solutions to modern safety challenges. Additionally, community service activities such as transportation safety campaigns enhance their ability to apply their knowledge in real-world settings. Through these activities, students not only deepen their understanding but also expand their professional networks.
